1: For the choir director. According to gittith.[a] A psalm by David. O Lord, our Lord, how majestic is your name in all the earth! Set this glory of yours above the heavens.[b]
2: From the lips of little children and nursing babies you have established strength[c] because of your foes, to put a stop to the enemy and the avenger.
3: Whenever I look up at your heavens, the works of your fingers, the moon and the stars, which you have set in place—
4: what is man that you remember him, the son of man[d] that you pay attention to him!
5: Nevertheless, you make him suffer need, apart from God for a while,[e] but you crown him with glory and honor.
6: You make him the ruler over the works of your hands. You put everything under his feet:
7: all flocks and cattle, and even the wild animals,
8: the birds of the sky, and the fish of the sea, which pass through the currents of the seas.
9: O Lord, our Lord, how majestic is your name in all the earth!
